title: Newtons first law - ring pulled by three forces

content.question: A ring is at rest and then three horizontal forces are exerted on it as shown in the top view figure. A short time after these forces are exerted on the ring, are the velocity components, <math alttext="v sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math>, positive, negative or zero?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="v sub y equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="v sub x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="v sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive

<math alttext="v sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is positive and <math alttext="v sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive

<math alttext="v sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is negative and <math alttext="v sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is negative and <math alttext="v sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
